Reviews.Title: “Nice stay”
Reviews.Author: 05andrew01
Reviews.Content: After reading other reviews prior to out trip I was concerned to the point of cancelling the reservation. After deciding to give it a shot I was pleasantly surprised. While not fancy, it provides clean rooms, and all advertised amenities. Beach access is great. Pool is ok. Nothing fancy. Staff was friendly and helpful.

Reviews.Title: “Great bargain, nice hotel.”
Reviews.Author: David S
Reviews.Content: Have stayed here before, but not recently. It is not an upper class hotel but it is very nice. Friendly staff. Clean rooms. Rooms are all suites with BR and LR with kitchenette. Kitchen is small (under counter fridge, cooktop but no oven, small microwave) but enough to get by with. Great locationat the quieter end of OC. The indoor pool is nice if you have kids. Got a midweek package off-season that has to be the best deal on the beach.

Reviews.Title: “Good Choice”
Reviews.Author: DBerly
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for a weekend trip. The motel is not new and is not a premiere resort property by any stretch of the imagination. What you do get is a reasonably priced suite that is oceanside and is more than adequate especially for those on a budget. The room was the same as I have experienced with most beach motels. I can only imagine trying to maintain carpets, bedding, and bathrooms in an environment with sand, salt, and humidity is a big task. The staff here does a great job in maintaining the rooms in an acceptable state. The staff were all very friendly. From the time we checked in until we departed we were greeted by staff members anytime we saw them. This included the desk staff, housekeeping, and maintenance personnel. Each and every one of them extended a greeting and a few words in passing. There were minor cosmetic issues with the room, but at this price and with a property of this age that can be expected. All in all, we got a suite with two double beds, a sleep sofa, and kitchenette for a very reasonable price within easy walking distance to the beach. The biggest complaint was the mattresses. They were very soft and offered little support. We did not get the best nights sleep for the two nights we were there. Overall we had a good experience and will lilkely stay here again in the future.

Reviews.Title: “Going there for over 20 years”
Reviews.Author: Mike H
Reviews.Content: My wife and I have been staying at Cayman Suites in Ocean City for over 20 years, and wouldn't consider staying anywhere else in O.C. The staff is friendly, the proximity to the beach is very convenient, and the suites are clean and well equipped. The suites are furnished with everything you need for your stay. The kitchette has plates, dinnerware, and cookware for 4, along with a 2 burner stove, microwave, coffee maker (with coffee), and a mini fridge with a 6 pack of coke. Each suite also has two televisions and two phones. There's also a free ice machine on the third floor.The only caution I would give, is unless you like the roar of motorcycles, avoid staying during The Bike Week Celebration...the noise from the motorcycles traveling up and down Costal Hwy can disturb your sleep then.

Reviews.Title: “PaHappy”
Reviews.Author: Duane I
Reviews.Content: Place was as advertised. Very Clean, staff was very polite and friendly. Close to the beach, hotel even supplies you with chairs for the beach! There are plenty of places in walking distance for shopping, food, and entertainment.

Reviews.Title: “partially updated room, polite staff, but noisy”
Reviews.Author: butterfly_happy
Reviews.Content: check in and reception, housekeeping staff were polite. nice welcome note and coupon for next booking, and a kite for the kiddos on the table in the room. parking is free. walk to beach, stores, restaurants, bus stop same block. it is an older cinder block structure. new carpet, fresh paint, furniture. bathroom was outdated, discolored, old fixtures, but clean. except for grout in corners of floor. they have stated they will be renovated this winter season. matresses had plasticy cover on them, but pillows had no protector so it smelled of other peoples head sweat. we always bring our own thank goodness. kitchenette is very small, cooking pans were cheapest quality. nowhere like a cupboard or shelf even to put grocery supplies. no drawers for silverware. coffeemaker was a tiny one cup camping one, but coffee for free in lobby. microwave was very outdated. no breakfast incl. did not use pool. could not use couch (it was new and clean) in living room area as a bed or to sit and relax on because there was no insulation between neighboring room walls and we could hear every whisper, burp, bodily function and conversation/movement of next room. there is a TV in bedroom we had to use so there was no battle of volume levels. hope to get polite mannered neighbors. they could update doors, the current ones must be hollow. there is a door separating living/bedroom. the sliding glass door to balcony is the original heavy cheap kind that is not even double insulated against heat/cold/UV elements let alone noise. noise ratings are relative, but this is like camping next to highway. yes i knew when i booked that this hotel was located on coastal highway, but assumed it would at least be insulated doors/glass! balcony rail slats looked too far apart and unsafe for younger than a 4 year old, so did not use balcony.

Reviews.Title: “teeplustwo”
Reviews.Author: Terri L
Reviews.Content: I do a great deal of traveling and we decided to do ocean city a week before the holiday, so now there is no wonder why this Hotel was not sold out when everywhere else was. The tub and bathroom was not clean, luckily I travel with disposable cleaning items and had to do house work away from home (on vacation). The Refrigerator had rusted shelves and looked like nothing I wanted to put my food in and was not set in place properly. There was only one flat screen tv in the living area- guess the upgrade did not extend to the tv in the bedroom (it was outdated). I'm used to a continental breakfast at the very least and at the prices we paid we were not satisfied with the all day coffee. Heck, I don't even drink coffee. My suggestion would be for the Hotel to invest in Umbrellas to accompany the chairs and towels they provide for the beach and to allow as many chairs and beach towels for all that are in your room. We were a family of three but were only allowed to get two towels and two chairs. I noticed from some of the other Hotels, they provided their guest carts to push their belongs to the beach area. Instead of having to carry in hand like we did. I'm also used to a business center or access to a computer. When I went to the front desk to ask the attendant to go on line and let me know how far an establishment I was looking for was from where we were - he was very hessitant and uncooperative as if that was not a service he provided. I put terrible as the rating for the Restaurant below (that wasn't accurate because there was none on the premises) there was no option to put n/a. We made the best of our summer ending vacation but I doubt if I would ever stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “great location / great staff / great value”
Reviews.Author: jill v
Reviews.Content: This was our 2nd time staying here. Loved it so much the first time we had to return. Suites are nice with a kitchenette. Stayed there with 3 children and never felt crowded. Fitness room is a great bonus and the kids liked hanging in the game room. Anytime we stopped by the front desk they were always pleasant, always had a smile on their face and just wanted to ensure we had a good time. Location is great - less than 2 minutes to walk onto the beach which was great if anyone needed to run back to the room. Room rates are extremely reasonable.

Reviews.Title: “Please read this review.”
Reviews.Author: reviewer1590
Reviews.Content: I'm begging you, do not stay or even consider going near this "hotel". Me and my family would actually prefer sleeping in our car, atleast there isn't mold growing on every inch of the walls. We came to ocmd for a week, stayed in a best western. It was 180 a night, included breakfast, and was suprisingly clean. We then decided to extend our stay 2 nights, and wanted to treat ourselves to a luxury stay. We decided for 250 a night, this place would be emaculate. This place was also advertised to have breakfast, which was a prime selling point because we liked to eat a big breakfast and buy a big dinner. No breakfast. Oh well. Atleast the room should be nice. We opened the door, my brother started crying. It may seem over the top, but it was really that bad. Mold and dust everywhere. Opened the microwave, a complete stench hit our faces. It was the worst stay of my life. The beds sucked. The ONLY somewhat good part was the tv. Please. Please. Do not go here.

Reviews.Title: “Not Feeling the VFM”
Reviews.Author: John S
Reviews.Content: If this hotel had been advertized as a crack house I would have been less surprised when we entered the room. For the price, however, we expected a lot more. We didn't want to let our baby crawl around on the floor, and in the bathroom floor there were hairs from all parts of the bodies of previous guests. I didn't take a shower, as I felt that I would be dirtier afterwards. We had booked for three nights and were told there would be a king-size bed, which there wasn't. The manager was extremely helpful and friendly and upgraded us for the night. We checked out early the following morning and went to the Holiday Inn Oceanfront where we had a much better experience.

Reviews.Title: “I had to Blog about it!”
Reviews.Author: Ladyi I
Reviews.Content: When we get to the hotel it looked a little smaller then the pictures online. I had to ask the woman at the front desk, where was the front desk; being that it look like we walked into a back door that would lead to the pool. After she let us know that we can sign in for our rooms there, we did. I thought it was a little weird that they asked me to pay up front for the stay, but I went with the flow. At this point I was tired, ready to take a shower, eat and sleep. I went upstairs to our room, and then the drama begins. The place look nothing like the pictures online. The coach look like something they took out the garbage with a hole on the arm and black stains. The black stains look like a running theme through out the room that needed a fresh coat of paint. The bed looked okay, until my sister found holes in the sheets. I went downstairs to explain to woman that we have problems in our room that was far worst then the two iron burns on the rugs. She said that she would give us another room. Of course, at this point we just want to leave but thought it could not be this bad. We looked in the second room to find mole in the bathroom. When we came back to say it is over, we can’t stay, we was told by a man who says he is not the manager that we could not get a refund. That is right, no refund and he was serious. My sister was getting angry and I was just to tired to. So I looked for my phone to call my credit card. By the time I came back from getting my phone out of the car, the woman at the front desk said that the owner would give us back our money. But we lost the 25 dollar cancellation fee. I know, I could have fought this and paid nothing. But at that point I was in a strange place and what seem more important at the time, was finding a clean place to lay for the night. We got our things and bolted out of there.

Reviews.Title: “Very Nice Place to Stay”
Reviews.Author: Kirk R
Reviews.Content: This was a recommendation we took from Trip Advisor. It was a great choice for the value, clean rooms, and friendly staff. This is not fancy, but it is spacious with clean suites with plenty of room for our family of 4. A great deal of extra thought by giving you beach towels and chairs as part of the service. It is not fancy on the outside, but do not let that fool you. For the money this is a great place to stay and the rooms themselves are very nice.

Reviews.Title: “Service Can Be Better”
Reviews.Author: Nimjitsu
Reviews.Content: I booked a room a month in advance, but had to cancel that booking less than 2 hours later when my work rescinded the time off. I was still charged the cancellation fee. I accept that I was at fault, but I wish they had been more accommodating of the situation as they could not have possible lost business within the 2 hours that I booked an off-season room. Prior to the call, I had considered rebooking at a different date, but now I'll think twice before I do that.

Reviews.Title: “Close to the beach but know pride in the up keep at all !”
Reviews.Author: Billfromcarroll
Reviews.Content: My stay here was OK until I saw that they have know pride in keeping the bld clean and in good shape. One house keeper I wanted to grab her around the neck for banging on the door eight o'clock in the morning and she said if I want service I had to get it now cause she was not going to hang around all day. Won't go back!!

Reviews.Title: “Great location; easy walk to the beach”
Reviews.Author: dbrenner06
Reviews.Content: We had a nice stay at this hotel. Even though it is not right on the beach, it is a short and easy walk. It is also within walking distance to Northside Park and various restaurants and shops. The rooms are clean and the suite layout worked well for my family. We would stay here again!

Reviews.Title: “Another Great Stay - Great Value!”
Reviews.Author: The4Ts
Reviews.Content: Another great stay for us! While we'd loved to try another hotel for our annual OCMD vacation, we just never do because we can't find a better value and we've looked hard! Five floors, located right on the ocean side of the Coastal Highway, and only two short blocks to walk to the beach. With five of us, it's hard to find enough space in a regular hotel room and all other suites are way over-priced. You get two decent sized rooms -- one "living area" with sleeper sofa, table/chairs, flat-screen TV, DVD player, kitchenette w/fridge & m-wave, nice-sized bathroom with good shower with nice hot water (actually maybe too hot for little kids!) and hair dryer, and separate bedroom (with door you can close) with two double beds or one king bed (this room faces the highway and you'll hear highway noise) with TV and DVD player. Always a fantastic value and clean (most importantly, NO BED BUGS!). Indoor, heated pool is small but adequate. Nice extras are that they give you two beach towels and two beach chairs per room -- this saves packing chairs and towels and is a plus! The front desk has DVD's you can sign out and watch for free (not a huge selection, but nice for the kids). Our only complaint this time, which is a first, was that the housekeeping staff was not as good as in year's past -- and that our housekeeper actually wrote "tips, please" on her tip envelope.... we know what the envelope is for and we don't need to be asked for a tip... I was disappointed in this and found it to be quite rude. Great stay as always, great value (you won't find better!), good location (except for the drive to the boardwalk, but we're fine with that), convenient to restaurants and stores, and, unless you're expecting the Ritz, you should be happy here!

Reviews.Title: “One night stay!”
Reviews.Author: kelso2011
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for one night as we were on our way home from Florida. We stopped because we love Ocean City. The staff was extremely great and friendly while I was booking the room and when we called they were pleasant on the phone. Very friendly staff. The room was great for what we needed for a one night stay. We were able to walk on the beach the next morning when we awoke. We were offered after checkout that we could leave our car and still use the beach and their facilites before we leaved, and would be given 2 beach chairs if we wanted which I thought was a great deal. I would recommend and stay there again if the occassion comes up for us.

Reviews.Title: “Great location... horrible, uncomfortable beds”
Reviews.Author: nanci_2001
Reviews.Content: Cayman Suites is conveniently located in North Ocean City- a very short walk to the beach. Many restaurants are located nearby, as well as Sunsations, a great beach store. The rooms were reasonably clean and a good size for a small family. There is a small kitchenette with two burners, a microwave, tiny sink, and small fridge. Dishes are included, but there is no toaster. However, this is where the love story ends. Although the staff was very helpful and friendly, every piece of furniture in the room was extremely uncomfortable. The couch, the pull out bed, the chairs... all fairly hard and uncomfortable. The king size bed in the bedroom was the most uncomfortable bed I have ever slept on in all of my travels. It was hard as a board and extremely unforgiving on my middle-aged body. I tossed and turned all night, every night, and got up in the morning with pain in my back, neck, hips and legs. Additionally, the sheets were very thin and uncomfortable- they felt like a cotton/poly blend- yuck! The toilet also gave us problems- it was loose on one side, and everytime we slightly leaned, the toliet came up off the floor like it was going to fall over. The toilet also took a long time to refill after flushing. The balcony was nice, but located directly facing coastal highway and the brutal afternoon sun rendered it unusable. On the plus side, we could see 4th of July fireworks from our front door. We purchased a 5 night package, but we checked out after 4 nights because my back just couldn't take another night in that bed. We did not get a refund for the unused night, but we didn't ask, either. We got home today, and my back hurts whenever I move. My young son was looking forward to the gameroom, but it was filled with 20 year old rusty games that cost .50 per game. They even had an old, rusty PacMan game! The A/C doesn't work in the game room, either. The elevator is incredibly slow. In summary, great location, lousy bed and amenities. If you are 18-25 and don't care about a comfortable bed, then this is the place for you- great location. If you are 40 plus like me, you might want to consider somewhere else.

Reviews.Title: “memorial day weekend”
Reviews.Author: aniram648
Reviews.Content: Stayed at Cayman suites Memorial day weekend. The GOOD: the room was dissent size, pretty clean, little kitchen was set up very good-plates, spoons, cups.. Close to the beach, close to the crabbing piers, free parking. The BAD: its not even bad- its shame for the workers. The front desk people cannot give you direction - they dont know anything. Where to go for fishing, for crabbing, to the mall... All of that you need to ask people on the street or the stores workers. The WORST: Night before we checked out at 8:30pm, I needed to print the direction from point A to point B . I got my laptop, I got my direction on, I asked to print out one page. The answer killed me: Only GENERAL MANAGER could use the printer, come tomorrow morning 9-5. Are we in 21st century or not?

Reviews.Title: “Off Season Mini-cation”
Reviews.Author: Phillyscraps
Reviews.Content: After Hurricane Irene forced us to reschedule our getaway we were very happy to finally arrive in OC, Md at the Cayman suites. The hotel's overall appearance was very clean and right off of coastal highway so it was very easy to get to and I was happy that we were so close to the beach. Our room was nice and being able to open the balcony doors was great, especially for us to catch some of the night air. The indoor pool was well kept although a little small so I was glad we were here on a slow weekend. I don't have any major complaints just a few hiccups that were resolved, like there was only one DVD player in the room, when we asked for another one the front desk clerk first told us we would have to wait to see what was available the next day, This was a little confusing since there were only a few other cars in the lot so no way could they be near capacity but I guess after some second thought the clerk decided to call Tom at home and make sure that is was okay to loan us a DVD player from another room (which he okayed) and the DVD player was brought to the room within the next hour. The other small issue was that on our way to the beach we grabbed four beach chairs and the clerk informed us adamantly that the rules are only two beach chairs per room. Well this is totally reasonable but again not only were we there off season but we were there during what was forecasted to be the coldest weekend in months so after debating with him for a few minutes and asking for the manager he and I compromised on us taking three chairs. Overall I would recommend the Cayman Suites as a good place to stay, in fact I already have.

Reviews.Title: “Shake, Rattle And Roll...”
Reviews.Author: Randall B
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Cayman Suites Hotel August 21 to the 24th. We were originally booked to the 25th but found ourselves on our first visit to Ocean City during natural disaster week and we were chased out by the hurricane. We did get to experience the earthquake though…our first! I mean this is a tongue-in-cheek way because seasoned travelers know that events can be planned but not outcomes. It is worth noting that this is a great time of year to visit this area because the rates are reduced and the weather is warm with plenty of vacationers still about. Finding affordable accommodations in Ocean City can be a challenge but this little gem of a place makes it an easy choice. We took advantage of one of their vacation packages which can be found on their website and provided us with a free night in addition to rates which were all ready running some 30 to 50 percent below the average. Cayman also provides an attractive beach bag, bucket of tasty caramel popcorn and a kite with the package as welcoming gifts. There is probably no better place to fly a kite than on the beach, so if you stink at it, now is your chance! Located some 100 blocks north of the boardwalk we were concerned about the location but after acclimating to the area we realized that this was perfect for us. With three of us, including mom, this stretch of strand is a little more on the quiet side, which we like. The drive down to the boardwalk is a snap with ample parking there and you get to see what businesses and attractions that you might like to visit on the way there. An affordable bus line can be accessed outside the front of the hotel if you are so inclined. In addition, a lovely park is located right across the street as well as a beachwear store, a few restaurants and ice cream shops including OC’s beloved Dumser’s. A pizza carry-out and a liquor store is also nearby which can come in handy when adult children vacation with their mom. The Hotel is also a hop and a skip from the Delaware border which affords a lovely and easy 20 minute drive up to Rehoboth Beach with it’s artisan community of lazy tree-lined streets, upscale shopping district and boardwalk. Beach access from the Cayman is short, safe and simple and with OC’s spacious sandy expanses three are no complications with overcrowding. A life guard was also stationed there. The hotel itself is bright and cheery, well maintained and clean. All appliances worked fine as did the shower, sinks etc… A street view balcony affords a repose for some people watching while the room entrance faces the sea and other properties. The area itself is laid back and put us in mind of North Myrtle Beach or any of those places where one stays in the U.S. in the beach condo district. Cayman has one indoor pool which can be viewed by the front-desk clerk. The kids seemed to be having a great time in it and it was almost always busy as Mid-Atlantic Oceans have cool waters. There was always someone at the desk who often greeted us as we would come and go. The place sports a rather nice arcade and fitness room. Vending and an ice machine were located on the floor below us and were in good working order. As stated earlier we prudently left a day early prior to evacuation due to the onset of Hurricane Irene as we did not want to get caught in heavy traffic on the drive back to Pittsburgh. Mary was very gracious and mailed us a generous certificate that amounted to a free nights’ stay should we choose to return. In these challenging economic times, Cayman Suites Hotel is being a friend by still affording working families a little slice of the good life. We highly recommend this hotel for you and your family!

Reviews.Title: “We would go back”
Reviews.Author: LadyDi4556
Reviews.Content: We went to OC MD. for the first time ever. We stayed at Cayman the staff was very friendly and helpful ,but because of the Hurricane they had a Mandatory Evacuation and it cut our trip short. They refunded any unused nights with no questions . For the money it was well worth it and a short walk to the beach. My only problem was the water pressure in the shower was very bad and it took a while to get the sand off. I thought the bed was adequate and I always check for bed bugs as soon as I get in the room they had a plastic bed cover over the mattress which I liked . All in all I thought it was a good place and I would give it thumbs up.

Reviews.Title: “Nice big rooms and front desk charm for OC”
Reviews.Author: karguy08
Reviews.Content: We actually booked this through extra credit card points we had, but the "value" listed on the CC site was $275. For that price, this review holds true with a nice value. The room was separated into a living area, hallway/bathroom area, and the bedroom itself. See a picture here: http://www.caymansuites.com/ocean-city-maryland-hotels.php We wanted a separate area for our daughter & pack & play to sleep, and this fit the bill nicely. The front desk was very helpful during check in, as we were looking for some food to order in. The nice gentleman tracked down a menu he thought was out in the lobby but they had run out of. We ordered on their recommendation and were quite happy; they even deliver to your room if wanted. The room was clean, and though you could tell needs updates, did have a flatscreen tv in the bedroom. By OC standards, it was nice. If you want to spend $400/night, which is all to easy to do on the beachfront, you will probably have a nicer place to stay in. I will say the bed was pretty poor, so that's the only true demerit I can give. Overall, very pleased and would stay again.

Reviews.Title: “NOT CLEAN - would not return to Cayman Suites.”
Reviews.Author: mbc123833
Reviews.Content: We chose Cayman Suites based on the information & pictures provided on their website, and also b/c the price was reasonable. The suites are a nice size and include a small kitchen w/ a microwave, refrigerator, small stove. There is also a separate bedroom, which we really like. However, the suite was not clean AT ALL, esp. the bathroom. The floor tile grout was black, there was sand caked in the corners, the shower floor mat was filthy, and the toilet rim (underneath) was visibly dirty. There was a small bottle of complimentary lotion sitting on the bathroom counter the entire time we were there that had a small hair sticking out from under the label. Obviously we had no intention of using that. Also, I would find single strands of dark hair on the side of the shower, on the shower curtain, etc. The kitchen was also not clean (the counter) and the sink didn't drain properly (gross). When we went to move the nightstand or dresser in the bedroom to plug things in, or the TV stand in the main area, we were disgusted by how dirty it was behind them, and when we lifted the bedskirt to look for something, we found pieces of food (cookies?). Even something as simple to fix as the small pad of paper left on the table in the kitchenette was not addressed - the top sheet was dirty & sticky (housekeeping could at least tear that off before the next guests arrive). We found an open bag of Q-tips sitting on the tray on the kitchenette table. Definite lack of attention to detail. The worst part of this experience was the owner's attitude when our concerns were brought to her attention. She had a "smug" attitude and was not willing to offer anything to pacify a clearly unhappy customer. I was told that I should have brought this to their attention sooner and that changes to reservations are only allowed 5 days in advance (we asked to check-out a day early & to receive our money back for the 3rd night we weren't going to use). I was told: "leave whenever you want to, but there would be no refund for the last night." Of course, one would never know until they actually arrive (certainly not 5 days in advance) that the property is not all that it is cracked up to be on their website. Pictures can be deceiving. Take it from someone who's seen it in person. The property is definitely in need of an overhaul (and a thorough cleaning). For what we paid per night (it averaged out to about $200/night w/ taxes, etc.), we expected MUCH more. Very disappointing experience.

Reviews.Title: “Best Kept Secret in OCMD!”
Reviews.Author: The4Ts
Reviews.Content: Hate to give this secret away, but after 32 years of OCMD visits and stays in many, many hotels, we keep going back to Cayman Suites time after time -- you won't get a better place for your money anywhere in Ocean City. Great place for families (our kids love it!). You can't beat the price for what you get... a clean (no bed bugs!), pleasant, roomy suite (2-double beds or a king bed with a sleeper sofa in the other room = sleeps 6), with nice size bathroom, kitchenette with fridge, two TV's and 2 DVD players (DVDs to use for free available from the office) and indoor pool. Easy 1-1/2 block easy walk to the beach without crossing the busy highway. While you do get traffic noise from being right on the main drag, with the AC on it's bearable. Check out the package deals... we got $50 gift certificate to one of three restaurants and a $10 for Dumser's ice cream + use of 2 beach chairs and beach towels (and this was with a 2-day stay!). Great place, great price, and would recommend it to anyone and it definitely should be rated better here.

Reviews.Title: “All in all enjoyed my stay”
Reviews.Author: IA101887
Reviews.Content: I stayed at Cayman Suites from July 21-24 . Travelling were 2 adults and 2 13 year old girls. PLUS:The location is excellent, a 1 block walk to the beach which can't be beat. Right across the street is Dairy Queen, and WAWA and CVS are 2 blocks away, also walkable. We stayed on the 5th (top) floor and would recommend a higher floor as you may then get a view from your balcony. The room was spacious , perfect for travelling with children. My husband and I slept in the bedroom, and the girls slept in the living room which has a pull out couch bed. *I recommend your children bring a sleeping bag for comfort*. The girls said the couch mattress was uncomfortable and were happier sleeping in their sleeping bags on the floor which worked out fine. VERY courteous staff - and very responsive. I told a worker that the 2nd floor bathroom was out of soap, and when I returned later soap was there. Indoor pool: what a bonus during the heat wave. The girls enjoyed it, and it is very clean. Mnus - This is the SLOWEST elevator I've ever experienced a wait of more than 5 minutes was the norm, so be prepared to wait, or take the stairs which I did They should NOT advertise there's a fitness room. There were 3 bikes, all not working1 seat cannot be adjusted, 1 the pedal fell off and 1 did not pedal at all. Oh, the treadmill worked, but first I needed to get the 'key' from the front desk. You are better off walking the beach or Coastal Highway if it's not too hot! HOUSEKEEPING: do yourself a favor and request an early room cleanup as soon as you are ready to leave for the beach. Otherwise you will return to your unmade bed and dirty towels. Decor is fine, really as long as the place is clean, who cares?I was there to enjoy the beach and relax. All said, good value and I would consider returning next summer!

Reviews.Title: “Eh.”
Reviews.Author: ElainePeters
Reviews.Content: Average hotel. Had good points and bad points. Never had a problem with parking. Close to beach. Had a suite instead of one room. Never heard our neighbors. Yes, you definitely hear the cars on Coastal Highway but there's nothing you can do about that. Great that they have beach chairs for you to use! The bad points were that our maid NEVER knocked before entering our room she just walked right in and scared the life out of us. I never knew of a hotel maid that did that, ever. Also, the maid takes forever to clean each room. One day it was almost 4pm and she still didn't clean. I told her to forget it, we all just wanted to take showers and head out for dinner. For our 4 night/ 5 day stay she cleaned the room ONCE. Use the stairs instead of taking the slowest elevator ever made. Expect a hard mattress. Expect an early morning walk up call on the last day of your stay, even though you didn't ask for one (the want you OUT).The staff, especially the owner, gave me attitude but she did it with a smile on her face so I guess that made her feel better? Won't stay there again. You get what you pay for. I'm going back to the suites at Princess Royale.

Reviews.Title: “Decent but could be great”
Reviews.Author: xtrimex
Reviews.Content: The Cayman suits is a average hotel with a great staff, but has the potential to be amazing. Upon checking in you will find ample parking, with a great central location registration area "next to the indoor pool". The lobby is average, could use a little updating but def. not bad. My suite was on the 4th floor which unlike the lower floors I could see the ocean at some points on the balcony and I imagine the 5th floor has a better view. The walls are a little thin but lets be honest nothing much the staff can do about that. Once entering the room, I was in the living area which has great amount of space. The only down side to the living room was the fire sprinkler was broken and hanging from the wall. The bathroom did have small amounts of rust around the ceiling, also shower head needed to be changed. The bed room was also very roomy and had a nice door so that you could have friends or kids stay in the living room on the pull out. Down side in the bed room, was the door lock leading to the balcony was broken, so the room was a little loud. Also the TV in the bed room was very small. Also the sprinkler was broken. The curtains were a little retro but these are beach suites what do you expect. I work in the business as a hotel hotel revamp specialist, also have worked as a concierge, but now work as a Blogger and Evaluator for travel and Leisure Mag. So I have seen a lot of hotels and I can see this hotel is Def. worth your money if can get it for under 115 a night "with tax" anything over and you are paying to much unless they do some much needed renovations. I would stay again as long as its not prime season.

Reviews.Title: “Average Hotel, but noisy”
Reviews.Author: ming724
Reviews.Content: We spent 3 nights in this hotel in Aug, 2010. The location is fine, close to beach, but you can not see the beach from the balcony (this is fine, considering the price), also it is just on the side of coastal hwy. The room is average, not too clean, not too dirty. You can rent beach chair and towels for free, but be careful the towel could be dirty. The biggest problem is noise, at night you can hear cars passing by, very difficult to fall in sleep!!

Reviews.Title: “Our place in Ocean City with a caring owner”
Reviews.Author: charlottecat
Reviews.Content: We have stayed at several places in Ocean City and surrounding area over the years, but settled on Cayman Suites about 10 years ago. For our family of five, the room setup is great and the value is unbeatable, particularly the Sun-Fri special. There are fancier and newer places, but you can't beat Cayman for the combination of value, location, indoor pool and the caring owner, Mary. Last year, we noted some issues we had regarding housekeeping, some minor, some concerning. I quickly received a personal reply from Mary, apologizing and requesting additional details so she could set about making things right. We corresponded several times and I am happy to report that we just returned from our vacation and everything was better than ever. The new housekeeping staff was wonderful and very friendly and the sofa bed has been improved greatly (prior one was hard to sleep on). The Cayman Suites will continue to be our place to stay in Ocean City.

Reviews.Title: “Was ok - probably would not return”
Reviews.Author: LJOHN01
Reviews.Content: We picked the place because it was a last minute decision to take a weekend trip to Ocean City. Was one of the very few available hotels that would allow you to stay one night, so that was a plus. Check in was pleasant and efficient. Room was spacious however very outdated - green carpet, pink walls...stain in bathroom was quite gross, didn't feel like walking barefoot in the room. Bedroom was a separate room with no windows so that was a negative, sunlight would probably have woken us up on time. However it was centrally located, close to restaurants and beach - so if you just need a place to stop and sleep - it fits the bill.

Reviews.Title: “A Good Value Close to the Beach”
Reviews.Author: Hawker_Dave
Reviews.Content: My family & I stayed in the Cayman Suites Hotel in Ocean City MD for six days earlier this August. We found the suite very comfortable with room for us to spread out. Our suite had a bed room with two double beds, TV & DVD player; a living room (with flat screen TV) and sideboard with microwave oven, refrigerator, coffee machine & sink. There are dishes & utensils for four people. The sofa in the living room is also a fold out bed, which we didn't need to use. The staff (front desk & maid service) were all very friendly & very helpful. We had one problem which was handled promptly with no fuss. We really enjoyed the location (on 125th Street, in North OC) which was only about a half block to the beach access. The courtesy beach chairs & beach towels was a very nice touch. There is an indoor pool which was something we were looking for, in case of rain. There is also a gym in the hotel. Parking is very convenient directly under & around the hotel. All in all, we were very happy to stay here. We liked the hotel, there are good restaurants & a grocery store very near the hotel and the Coastal Highway bus service picks up & drops off near this hotel. We liked the Cayman Suites and recommend it to others. We'd like to return and book in here when coming back to Ocean City.

Reviews.Title: “Caymen Suites Motel not Hotel”
Reviews.Author: sherrietoliver
Reviews.Content: This was a mini-vacation for my daughter and girlfriends before she started college. Caymen has great location to commercial areas and beach. The desk staff were cordial and welcoming. Coffee in the lobby. Don't look for restaurant. Only snack/soda machines. The parking area was a bit small. We retrieved luggage cart to get bags to our room on 2nd fl. The room was quaint with living area/kitchenette. Bathroom set-up with linen for three ( Upon request for addn'l bath linen, front desk never had wash cloths - 2x). The bathroom floor was dirty, to include leftover sand. Separate bedroom with two double beds. Balcony was great except for water dripping from above. Housekeeping did not make up one beds because of a couple of clothing items the kids left on it. I did reserve late in the season, so this was sufficient for rest and general hygiene ($229/night). The girls had a bang of a time.

Reviews.Title: “Great location, but you get what you pay for.”
Reviews.Author: lyss8485
Reviews.Content: The hotel wasn't luxurious by any means. Our room was an adjoining suite - it was small, but had everything we needed. And while it was clean, it wasn't anything to write home about. Our toilet paper wasn't restocked either of the two days we were there and it didn't look like housekeeping even bothered to tidy up. But I can't complain too much. My boyfriend and I only paid $100.00 for both nights...so, in essence, we got what we paid for. The hotel is great for low budget travelers who are just looking for a bed to sleep in at the end of a long night. One thing I really loved was the location - one block from the beach and smack dead in the middle of Ocean City's best bars and restaurants.

Reviews.Title: “Family Friendly Hotel in Ocean City Maryland”
Reviews.Author: skippyhurricane
Reviews.Content: Cayman Suites is a suites type hotel on 125th street in Ocean City, Maryland. The rooms are efficiency suites with separate areas for parents and kids. The hotel has a nice indoor pool and is close to restaurants and shopping. It's very affordable and the staff is always friendly.

Reviews.Title: “Caymen”
Reviews.Author: carlxundead
Reviews.Content: Room was nice for the price.. Pool could have been bigger & a hot tub would have been nice & better parking but over all it was a nice place!

Reviews.Title: “We had a great time and will be back next year”
Reviews.Author: engine9driver
Reviews.Content: We stayed on the 4th floor, checked in late thursday night and had a very nice clean room. The use of the beach chairs and towels was great, the pop corn and coke and the free kite in the room was really cool! Thank you for making our short mini vacation really nice!

Reviews.Title: “Reasonably priced, clean, overall met my expectations.”
Reviews.Author: stjinnova
Reviews.Content: This is a somewhat older hotel on the north side of Ocean City. It is affordable and has good and bad qualities but overall was satisfying for the price. We were very content with our stay and would return. 1. The hotel is right on Coastal Highway, the main drag through OC. The bedroom side of every suite faces the road. It can be a little noisy because of this - bring some earplugs. The upside of its location is that there is plenty to eat and do within easy walking distance. 2. The hotel itself is a little older. Has a very seafoam-and-salmon kind of decor that is a little outdated. We were there for the beach, not the decor, however, so no bother. 3. We stayed on a midweek package which included some dinner gift cards. Had a minor hassle with one of the cards, which was handled perfectly by the management. We were very pleased with this. 4. The hotel is really more like 2 1/2 blocks to the beach, but it's a nice quiet section of beach, and you'll enjoy it. 5. The indoor pool is a quite pleasant little respite from the beach. Bottom line - it's a bargain room close to the beach. We were happy and will return.

Reviews.Title: “Okay Hotel”
Reviews.Author: MamabearMack
Reviews.Content: My husband and I decided to book the hotel even though there were some bad reviews. We arrived at 3 pm and were checked in promptly. The staff were friendly and no one got snotty with us. The room was clean and did not smell. But we did have a few small problems in our room. First, we could constantly here dragging noises from the floor above us, like some one was moving furniture. Then one morning house keeping was banging on our door and we told her to please wait but she just pushed her way in the door, then the following morning we got a call from the front desk asking us why the lobby furniture was in front of our room door and then sending maintenence to make sure we had no other people in our room, they had thought we had kids when we do not and I explained to them that we were adults and would not do that. Which I kept my cool and did not get nasty with them like I wanted to. And the weekend we were there, there were young people there so quite possibly they could have done that but who knows. I dont recommend the pool because it feels like a sauna room when you walk in and you cant breathe from all the heat !!!

Reviews.Title: “You get what you pay for.”
Reviews.Author: brian_niborski
Reviews.Content: We arrived around 3pm and were checked in by 3:05pm which was great because the kids were tired. The rooms are dated. The sheets are a bit stiff, but what can you expect from a hotel that is much cheaper than others. The kltchenette worked perfectly and the room were cleaned everyday. It did have some kind of order, but that was easily remedied with candles. If this hotel updated the interior of the rooms it would be an A+ for sure.

Reviews.Title: “Good bang for your buck”
Reviews.Author: mipperdip
Reviews.Content: The suites are nice size, clean for the most part.......The bathroom ceiling needed repair (rust stains) and the tile floor could use a good scrubbing, but the place is old so what can you expect...the beds were comfy and the air conditioners could have froze meat- they worked awesome - nice balcony - ......Overall it was worth it for the price.........You can't expect luxury on a budget......The hotel staff was very friendly and helpful. They let you use their umbrellas, beach chairs and towels for free........ I would stay there again for the price. The one bad part was the hose off facility in the parking deck.......after walking back from the beach at the foot of the steps in the parking deck is where you hose off the sand.....it's an actual hose with the end cut.......it felt kind of strange...... Parking is free but cramped - very small spaces....

Reviews.Title: “Adequate”
Reviews.Author: xrowen
Reviews.Content: If you take all the reviews listed on this site about this hotel, and average them up, that would pretty well sum this place up. Positives include the hotel’s location, roomy suite, safe and clean enough. Negatives are things like dated fixtures and furniture. Our room also had a funky smell (B.O.???) that airing out the room helped but did not cure. Embassy Suites it is not, but good enough for a beach town!

Reviews.Title: “Great place to stay...”
Reviews.Author: ericreif
Reviews.Content: We were very happy to stay here. We took a pacage for 4 days 3 nights. Every staff person was so nice..the rooms were great (no smell). my boys ..6&4 were so excited about the flat screen in there room(livingroom)and the pull out couch. it was only a block and a half away from the beach,and it was about 20 minutes away from the boardwalk. it was so nice to stay off the board walk (no riff-raff). 2 things we (wife and i) didn t like was..no continental breakfast,which we new about and the king bed was hard. but other wise we had nothing else bad to say about the hotel...and a thanks to bill for greeting me and my family everytime we walked through that door,it was nice to feel welcomed..

Reviews.Title: “great hotel, friendly staff”
Reviews.Author: wavewatcher60
Reviews.Content: This is our fourth trip to OC so know about the area. This hotel is quiet and not in a loud section. Room was clean and comfortable. Was surprised that it was stocked with pots, pans, dishes and utensils. They have sand chairs and towels available if you do not have your own. We asked if we could leave our car in the parking lot on the day of checkout and was told yes. We were told we could use outside shower and change our clothes in the public bathrooms. Staff was very friendly and helpful. Well worth the money for Ocean City. Located near several of the larger resturants and close to the beach.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect Vacation”
Reviews.Author: scoops42
Reviews.Content: I just got back from probably one of the best vacations ever, mostly due to the accomidations from the Cayman Suites. I booked this kind of last minute and forgot that it was Senior Week. To my surprise there weren't to many high schoolers in the hotel and the hotel was really quiet. Great location and the balcony was really cool to hang out on. The weather was kind of crappy most of the week and the Friday we were supposed to leave was going to be the best day of the week. I asked the gentleman at the front desk if he could possibly work out us staying another night. He was cool enough to let us stay another night which really made the vacation worth it. Great place to stay and I would stay again in a heartbeat.

Reviews.Title: “Ok place”
Reviews.Author: KittyAB
Reviews.Content: The furniture was dated and the kitchen area is small and had ants. Not a good shower. BUT the room itself was huge. The staff was very friendly and helpfull.

Reviews.Title: “Average room with ants”
Reviews.Author: Butterfly123Maryland
Reviews.Content: Although the location was great (right on the main strip and on the beach), the room was just under our comfort level- dank, humid, dark and with ants all over one of the dressers. There was a nice balcony where you can sit and see the ocean. Not really worth it for the price-- it's okay if you don't really care about the room, but not if you're looking for a very comfortable vacation.

Reviews.Title: “Worked for me”
Reviews.Author: tch912
Reviews.Content: I stayed at this hotel for one night during the state teachers convention. I had tried to book other hotels but they wanted you to stay at lease two nights. This property came up when I went to hotels. com and I checked the reviews on tripadvisor. They were very favorable. I booked it for one night. I did not know it was a suite until I arrived. It was large with a living and dining area and a separate sleep area with two double beds. A friend went along for the ride and we both thought it was great. It was very clean with plenty of towels and an extra sink. The management was great. It was right on Coastal Hwy which is the main strip. There were lots of places to eat and an easy commute to the convention center. I am looking at taking my grandchildren there next summer. If you are looking for a luxury hotel this will not be for you but if you want clean and comfort with space enough to sleep six comfortably then stay here.

Reviews.Title: “decent place to stay”
Reviews.Author: surfboat
Reviews.Content: To whom it may concern: The stay was decent .No complaints.The room was perfect for 5 persons.The staff was helpful and friendly with the setting up of the room and of the local happenings in the area.(The owner is a local) The room was clean and comfortable.Our family will be staying there again.For those of you looking for the lap of luxury O. C. is not the place.(Go to the Med.)

Reviews.Title: “Nice place to stay”
Reviews.Author: tempest2112
Reviews.Content: Cayman Suites is located just south of the Delaware border in North Ocean City. My family arrived here on August 19, and spent two nights and three days for a end of the season beach getaway. First off if you want quick access to the boardwalk, this is not the place for you. The boardwalk is about a mile away. That being said it’s a mixed blessing. The closer to the boards, the higher the rates. More noise. More traffic. The boardwalk and for that matter all of the main strip of Ocean City is easily accessible by a clean safe bus service that runs all day and well into the night for $2.00 all day access. Definitely the way to go. The beach however is just one block up. The hotel provides two free beach chairs and an umbrella. It was very easy to set up first thing in the morning, come back and forth for bathroom trips or for lunch. The four of us stayed in a king suite which had a separate bedroom for the king and a twin pullout sofa in the living area. A small fridge, microwave and two burner stove top as well as silverware, cookware and dishes are supplied. The hotel also has a small heated indoor pool which we didn’t get a chance to use. The room was neat and clean, but was starting to show some age. Also the walls in the living area are thin. We fortunately had neighbors that were respectful of this fact but I could see where this may become an issue. The one thing that makes this hotel stand out was the staff. From the folks at the front desk to housekeeping, everyone had a friendly hello and were more than willing to help. All in all it was a good value for the price. We were near to the beach and in a nice part of town. No complaints, just a nice place to stay. The Good - Price was reasonable Room was clean and well appointed Beach just one block away with no streets to cross Many restaurants, food and beach supply stores within walking distance Service was above average Free use of beach chairs and umbrella The Bad - Far from boardwalk Thin walls Clean room but starting to show some age

Reviews.Title: “Good room...Bad attitudes”
Reviews.Author: well-traveled32
Reviews.Content: I had read some undesirable reviews about the Cayman Suites but decided to go ahead and stay there anyway. From the moment we got there, we were greeted with bad attitudes from the people at the front desk. We had asked if we could possible check-in to our room some time before the 3 o'clock check-in time (which we have done at every other hotel we've stayed at in OC, MD) and the front desk clerk insisted that was not an option. He insisted that it took till that time for all the rooms to be ready. He also went as far as to say that other hotels are starting to have check-in times as late as 4 or 5 (guess this was his way of saying 3 was good). He just rubbed us the wrong way. So we said fine and went to the beach for a couple of hours. We came back at 3 to check-in and there was a long line at the front desk. Many people were commenting on how rude the front desk personnel were and couldn't understand why they couldn't have been let into their rooms 10 to 15 minutes early to avoid the crush of people checking in. I guess in their minds dealing with a big crowd of frustrated people is better than letting people in a little early than 3. So that was that, as for the room, it was fine. It was quite spacious, but very outdated. It was clean enough, but there was mold in the shower. Mold can be quite unhealthy and it just doesn't give you the feeling that the place is well attended to. A simple bleach solution would probably remedy it. All in all, we had a great time, but wouldn't ever stay at this place again nor would we recommend it to anyone. There are many different places to stay in Ocean City, MD, and I would recommend giving your money to a place that is accommodating and friendly to their guests.

Reviews.Title: “Loved the Cayman”
Reviews.Author: pjpreds
Reviews.Content: We had a great time! Booked online through OC Vacation Guide. Rooms were very clean and had everything we needed. Great for our family of 5. Nice location. Very family oriented part of OC. Staff was extremely friendly and got us whatever we needed. Would definetly go back! Nice for a getaway!

Reviews.Title: “The Best For Less”
Reviews.Author: PittsburghVacation
Reviews.Content: Why pay more elsewhere? Cayman Suites is the best Hotel for the price around. Our room was clean comfortable and cozy. You couldn't ask for a better location. Away from the hustle and bustle of downtown O.C, yet only a 1 block walk to the beach. Do not expect luxury! Anyone seeking spa treatment and a sensual massage by a muscle-bound guy named Sven should look elsewhere. This is a quality Hotel for those who want the best for their budget. Anyone who has written a bad review for Cayman Suites should be ashamed! Thank you Cayman Suites! Go Steelers.

Reviews.Title: “"Look past the pink...it's quaint!!!"”
Reviews.Author: hottie511
Reviews.Content: This hotel has poor curb appeal (ex. pink exterior walls) but the hotel is great. Our hotel room had a separate living room and king-size bedroom and had a kitchenette area with dining table. the bathroom was updated and clean. We could see the ocean from both the front door and the balcony. Yes, that's right, although it was about a 1/2 mile away from the ocean, we were on the 5th floor and could see the water from BOTH ways!!! I mean, we had a great 5 star time, even though the room wasn't polished in gold and marble. It was clean, the staff were very friendly, and the room was just what we asked. We got a reasonable rate for a room that was BIGGER than our room that we stayed in that was right on the boardwalk. They even have a small DVD collection at the front desk for you to choose from FREE and yes, there is a DVD player in the bedroom. If you want a simply furnished room with space to move around, then book here but if you want every one of the amenities, then go elsewhere. We stayed off-season and got a corner room with a balcony facing coastal highway for under $100 per night.

Reviews.Title: “Great time at the Cayman Suites”
Reviews.Author: beany696
Reviews.Content: We were to begin our vacation on Monday, August 18th, but at the last minute, we decided we could leave home for our trip a day early. When we arrived at the Cayman with reservations to begin on Monday, they found us a suite for the week. We didn't even have to move. The staff was professional and most of all, friendly, especially Michelle, the front desk clerk. When we asked for anything, they came through. The suite we had was everything we thought it would be and more. We overlooked the bay AND the ocean. The beds and sofa-bed were comfortable, the kitchenette had everything we needed, and the bathroom was clean. The location of the Cayman Suites is wonderful, too. Not too close nor too far from everything Ocean City offers.

Reviews.Title: “You're in for a treat, but don't expect anything 5 Star”
Reviews.Author: SimoneF
Reviews.Content: I am very cautious when I travel and came over to Trip Advisor before I booked my Ocean City getaway. Based on the reviews I felt comfortable booking this hotel, and it turned out to be a great thing. The Cayman Suite was just what I was looking for. It was convenient to all food, entertainment, and the beach. When I arrived my paperwork and keys were waiting for me (no need to look me up in the computer first to see if I actually had a reservation). The room itself (I had a king suite) looked very modern, and was very well kept. For the price I paid it was well worth it. I can definitely see myself staying here again. When it comes to the Cayman Suites, don't go in expecting a 5 Star Hotel, and you'll be pleasantly surprised.

Reviews.Title: “Very nice hotel”
Reviews.Author: BaltimoreHappyCamper
Reviews.Content: We stayed in this hotel from August 11th till August 18th. I think that for the family of four it is a perfect place for the money. The staff was very friendly, professional and helpful, the rooms were very clean and comfortable. Hotel also provides beach towels, umbrella and two chairs, which was extremely convenient. The pool was nice, not at all crowded, and towels for the pool were also provided. The kitchenette was actually bigger than I expected: it had dishes for 4, stove, refrigerator, and coffee/tea maker. The only thing I wish they had was a laundry facility, but other than that hotel had everything we needed. We will definitely stay there next year.

Reviews.Title: “Served it's purpose”
Reviews.Author: beachiemom
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Cayman Suites August 11th for 4 nights. We have two daughters (11 and 12). Our room had two beds and there is a separate sitting area from the bedroom... w/a stovetop, microwave, sink, small refrigerator and coffe maker. This was all nice and convenient. The room was clean, the staff friendly. It is not a top notch hotel, but like I said in my title, it served it's purpose. Our balcony opened out to Coastal Hwy, which was a little noisy at night and not a real scenic view. It was nice to be on ocean block, but would prefer ocean front next time. The beds were small! We slept two in a bed and it was tight! The pull out couch was very uncomfortable... as a couch and as a bed! The hotel offers beach towels (the size of postage stamps!), beach umbrellas and very small beach chairs complementary. That was a nice perk, but we only took advantage of the umbrellas and brought our own towels and chairs. The pool is indoor and very small. All in all, we had a nice time, but don't expect luxury!

Reviews.Title: “Not great but a very good value and good location”
Reviews.Author: NewYorkMimi
Reviews.Content: We just came back from staying 3 nights at the Cayman Suites. We felt that for the price, it was a very good deal. Spacious layout, good location (beach about 2 blocks behind the hotel or boardwalk about 7 miles away by car) and a great bed. Also, the fridge in the kitchen is a decent size, and the efficiency kitchen was very useful. Downsides? A little dirty. Granted it is a beachside property, after the first hour of walking around barefoot in the room, all our feet were BLACK (not kidding). They not only need to vacuum but regularly steam clean their carpeting in the rooms. Also, the rooms are tidied more than cleaned, we felt. It smelled like the people who were there before (body odor, lotion, smoking smells) and although housekeeping came everyday, it was apparent that no true cleaning products were used. Again, we knew we weren't getting top of the line for this price, and it is still a good value, but if they could just get it cleaned better, I feel less people would complain.

Reviews.Title: “Nice place for the money”
Reviews.Author: daphne123
Reviews.Content: I really liked the hotel. We stayed on Fri and Sat nights. The hotel was fully booked, but didn't seem crowded. The pool was nice, just right for a dip, not overly crowded. The parking situation was fine, convenient. I like the size of this place, with just 50-some units, you get personal service. The rooms are clean and have everything you could wish for, kichenette with dishes silverware, table and chairs, coffee maker, mini-fridge. The king suite is perfect for a small family, because the parents can sleep in the bedroom, with the children on the pull-out sofa in the living area, giving you privacy. You can also order up a comfy cot for an additional charge if you wish. The bathroom had a pull out clothes line and was spacious and comfortable. The desk people were the nicest I've seen in Ocean City, really made me feel welcome, and even the maids and maintenance gave you personal attention with a smile. Check in was efficient and friendly. It's not the Ritz, let's face it, the blankets and towels could be more luxe, but it was a clean comfortable, homey type of hotel. I would definitely stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “Happy Holiday with Cayman”
Reviews.Author: lkozak
Reviews.Content: Just returning after a five night stay at the Cayman suite on 125 Street in Ocean City. I was a little worried after reading the review from earlier this years so I email Cayman and let them know my concerns. They assured me that I would have a pleasant stay and I could check out the room first before deciding to stay. I was happy to hear this and my mind was at ease. My husband took total charge(as I basked in the sun on the beach)to check out the room. After inspection of the room my husband gladly reported that everything looked just fine. And it was. There was a spacious living area with a clean pull out bed. The kitchen consisted of the basic neccessities.(I'm not cooking a full courser on vacation) The bedroom was fine too. The best thing about staying at the Cayman Suites over the fourth of July is that you have a front row seat for the fireworks just across Coastal Highway at the park. This year the fireworks were cancelled due to weather conditions, however we were not let down. On July 5th we witness a spectacular display from our balcony. No driving, No bus riding, No setting in the rain waiting for the fireworks, just walk out on your balcony and your ready for the show!!!! Also, if you have children, on July 4th at the park(just right across coastal highway) they have games for the children, entertainment, and a great playground. The Cayman Suites is your usual hotel. Nothing fancy however it was clean, comfortable and a great location for the 4th of July celebrations!

Reviews.Title: “Great Time!!!”
Reviews.Author: kemery
Reviews.Content: My family and I stayed here in the past but this year was exceptional. The hotel has had alot of polishing up work done and it looks great. The staff is always very friendly and the rooms are always clean. The pool was great and also was redone. The temperature of the water was perfect. We just had an awesome time. Thanks for the great experience again this year and of course, we will be back. Everyone should try this hotel to have a great time.

HotelInfo.Name: Cayman Suites
HotelInfo.Address: 12500 Coastal Hwy, Ocean City, MD 21842
